1. In this Regulation,

“executive director” means the Executive Director of Education and Research of the Ministry of Agriculture and Food; (“directeur général”)

“Museum premises” includes all lands, buildings and facilities owned or operated by the Museum. (“lieux du Musée”) R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 1.

Procedure

content.content: 2. The Board shall meet not less than three nor more than six times in any year at the call of the chair in consultation with the chief executive officer. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 2.
content.raw_html: 2. The Board shall meet not less than three nor more than six times in any year at the call of the chair in consultation with the chief executive officer. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 2.

content.content: 3. There shall be an executive committee of the Board which shall consist of the chair, vice-chair, secretary and one other member elected by the Board. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 3.
content.raw_html: 3. There shall be an executive committee of the Board which shall consist of the chair, vice-chair, secretary and one other member elected by the Board. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 3.

content.content: 4. The executive committee shall meet at the call of the chair in consultation with the chief executive officer. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 4.
content.raw_html: 4. The executive committee shall meet at the call of the chair in consultation with the chief executive officer. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 4.

content.content: 5. The secretary of the Board shall send notice of all meetings together with an agenda to all persons concerned and shall keep a record of all meetings. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 5.
content.raw_html: 5. The secretary of the Board shall send notice of all meetings together with an agenda to all persons concerned and shall keep a record of all meetings. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 5.

content.content: 6. Special meetings of the Board, in addition to those authorized by section 2, may be called by the chief executive officer or the executive director. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 6. Use of Museum Premises

6. Special meetings of the Board, in addition to those authorized by section 2, may be called by the chief executive officer or the executive director. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 6.

Use of Museum Premises

content.content: 7. No person or organization shall be granted exclusive access to or use of Museum premises to the exclusion of other persons or organizations. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 7.
content.raw_html: 7. No person or organization shall be granted exclusive access to or use of Museum premises to the exclusion of other persons or organizations. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 7.

content.content: 8. No person or organization may use Museum premises for any purpose other than general admission without first having made written application to, and obtaining the approval of, the chief executive officer. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 8.
content.raw_html: 8. No person or organization may use Museum premises for any purpose other than general admission without first having made written application to, and obtaining the approval of, the chief executive officer. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 8.

content.content: 9. No person shall smoke or commit a nuisance in or near Museum buildings, equipment or displays. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 9.
content.raw_html: 9. No person shall smoke or commit a nuisance in or near Museum buildings, equipment or displays. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 9.

content.content: 10. No person shall, on Museum premises, (a) deface, remove or damage any property; (b) remove, injure or destroy any tree, shrub, plant, flower or growing thing or any soil, rock or other material; (c) kill, trap, hunt, pursue or in any manner disturb or cause to be disturbed any wild or domestic bird or animal; or (d) abandon any refuse or other object or material except in receptacles or pits provided for that purpose. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 10.
content.raw_html:
10. No person shall, on Museum premises,

(a) deface, remove or damage any property;

(b) remove, injure or destroy any tree, shrub, plant, flower or growing thing or any soil, rock or other material;

(c) kill, trap, hunt, pursue or in any manner disturb or cause to be disturbed any wild or domestic bird or animal; or

(d) abandon any refuse or other object or material except in receptacles or pits provided for that purpose. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 10.

content.content: 11. No person shall bring or allow a pet to be brought inside any Museum building. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 11.
content.raw_html: 11. No person shall bring or allow a pet to be brought inside any Museum building. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 11.

content.content: 12. Owners of dogs or other pets on Museum premises shall at all times keep them on a leash that does not exceed six feet in length and shall not permit any such animal to come within 100 yards of any place where livestock or poultry are kept. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 12.
content.raw_html: 12. Owners of dogs or other pets on Museum premises shall at all times keep them on a leash that does not exceed six feet in length and shall not permit any such animal to come within 100 yards of any place where livestock or poultry are kept. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 12.

content.content: 13. (1) Except with the written permission of the chief executive officer, no person shall, on Museum premises, (a) be in possession of or fire or discharge any firearm, rocket or other fireworks; (b) erect, post, paste, fasten, paint or affix any placard, bill, notice or sign; (c) remain on the premises during other than normal business hours; (d) sell or offer for sale any article or service; (e) advertise or carry on any business or commercial enterprise; (f) beg or solicit charity; (g) conduct a show of any kind or bring any equipment therefor; (h) conduct a public meeting or perform any act that congregates or is likely to congregate persons; (i) light or maintain a fire in a place other than a location provided for that purpose; (j) operate a vehicle except on a roadway or other place provided for that purpose; (k) operate a vehicle at a speed in excess of fifteen miles per hour; (l) park a vehicle in a place other than one set aside for that purpose; (m) operate a snowmobile, motor toboggan or any motor-propelled vehicle; or (n) land or operate an aircraft. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 13 (1). (2) No person shall camp or remain overnight on Museum premises. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 13 (2). Français
content.raw_html:
13. (1) Except with the written permission of the chief executive officer, no person shall, on Museum premises,

(a) be in possession of or fire or discharge any firearm, rocket or other fireworks;

(b) erect, post, paste, fasten, paint or affix any placard, bill, notice or sign;

(c) remain on the premises during other than normal business hours;

(d) sell or offer for sale any article or service;

(e) advertise or carry on any business or commercial enterprise;

(f) beg or solicit charity;

(g) conduct a show of any kind or bring any equipment therefor;

(h) conduct a public meeting or perform any act that congregates or is likely to congregate persons;

(i) light or maintain a fire in a place other than a location provided for that purpose;

(j) operate a vehicle except on a roadway or other place provided for that purpose;

(k) operate a vehicle at a speed in excess of fifteen miles per hour;

(l) park a vehicle in a place other than one set aside for that purpose;

(m) operate a snowmobile, motor toboggan or any motor-propelled vehicle; or

(n) land or operate an aircraft. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 13 (1).

(2) No person shall camp or remain overnight on Museum premises. R.R.O. 1990, Reg. 867, s. 13 (2).
